feature.name: Agate
feature.origin: Banded gemstone, variety of the mineral chalcedony.

feature.name: Alexandrite
feature.origin: Gemstone notable for its color change, appearing green in daylight, but red under incandescent light; a variety of chrysoberyl.

feature.name: Almandine
feature.origin: Red to violet-red gemstone, a variety of the mineral garnet.

feature.name: Amazonite
feature.origin: Light bluish-green gemstone, a variety of the mineral orthoclase.

feature.name: Amethyst
feature.origin: Violet gemstone, a variety of the mineral quartz.

feature.name: Aquamarine
feature.origin: Blue-green and light blue gemstone, a variety of the mineral beryl.

feature.name: Chernykh Regio
feature.origin: Nikolai Stepanovich; Soviet and Ukrainian astronomer, discovered asteroid (2867) Steins (1931-2004).

feature.name: Chrysoberyl
feature.origin: Yellow or brownish-green gemstone, the third hardest gemstone after diamond and sapphire.

feature.name: Citrine
feature.origin: Yellow gemstone, a variety of the mineral quartz.

feature.name: Diamond
feature.origin: Rare and precious gemstone, the hardest natural substance.

feature.name: Emerald
feature.origin: Green gemstone, a variety of the mineral beryl.

feature.name: Garnet
feature.origin: Group of related minerals found in a variety of colors and often cut as gemstones.

feature.name: Jade
feature.origin: Semitransparent to translucent gemstone, a variety of the minerals nephrite and jadeite.

feature.name: Lapis
feature.origin: Lapis Lazuli; gemstone formed from a rock containing a number of minerals, the quality and value determined by the color and abundance of the blue mineral lazurite.

feature.name: Malachite
feature.origin: Translucent to opaque gemstone, usually banded or rich green and often found with azurite.

feature.name: Obsidian
feature.origin: Volcanic glass used as a gemstone.

feature.name: Onyx
feature.origin: Gemstone variety of the mineral chalcedony.

feature.name: Opal
feature.origin: Non-crystalline gemstone noted for its rich play of colors when turned in the light.

feature.name: Peridot
feature.origin: Green gemstone, a variety of the mineral olivine.

feature.name: Sapphire
feature.origin: All colors of gemstones of the mineral corundum (except red, which is the gemstone ruby) are called sapphires.

feature.name: Topaz
feature.origin: Gemstone that occurs in a wide variety of colors.

feature.name: Tourmaline
feature.origin: Gemstone noted for its beautiful, multi-colored prismatic crystals.

feature.name: Turquoise
feature.origin: Opaque blue-to-green mineral of arid climates that has been used as a gemstone for thousands of years.

feature.name: Zircon
feature.origin: Gemstone that is colorless in its pure form, but also found in yellows, browns, and reds.
